pullRequest.body:
This PR includes some equalities and equivalences about expressions with integer numbers.

They can be useful as rewriting lemmas to simplify expressions.

(See #8102 for motivation)

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [57757f8e22](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23275/commits/57757f8e229842f7946305be8b11c7076134eaa0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ div_le_div_iff_of_dvd_of_neg_of_neg`
`+ div_le_div_iff_of_dvd_of_neg_of_pos`
`+ div_le_div_iff_of_dvd_of_pos_of_neg`
`+ div_le_div_iff_of_dvd_of_pos_of_pos`
`+ div_le_iff_of_dvd_of_neg`
`+ div_le_iff_of_dvd_of_pos`
`+ div_lt_div_iff_of_dvd_of_neg_of_neg`
`+ div_lt_div_iff_of_dvd_of_neg_of_pos`
`+ div_lt_div_iff_of_dvd_of_pos`
`+ div_lt_div_iff_of_dvd_of_pos_of_neg`
`+ div_lt_iff_of_dvd_of_neg`
`+ div_lt_iff_of_dvd_of_pos`
`+ le_div_iff_of_dvd_of_neg`
`+ le_div_iff_of_dvd_of_pos`
`+ lt_div_iff_of_dvd_of_neg`
`+ lt_div_iff_of_dvd_of_pos`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Integer division is quite specific to... integers. So there is no typeclass that would be suitable to generalise those lemmas (nor does it seem fit to do so)
Since they might be useful too, I added the corresponding versions with negative denominators.

These lemmas certainly look very useful! I think it would be great to generalise them to other ordered rings (assuming the existence of a suitable division of course). 

`LinearOrderedRing` seems like it might be the right typeclass for this - what do you think @YaelDillies ?

```suggestion
theorem div_le_iff_of_dvd_of_pos (a b c : ℤ) (h1 : 0 < b) (h2 : b ∣ a) : a / b ≤ c ↔ a ≤ b * c := by
```
(and similarly in a few of the statements below:)

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨_, hx⟩ := h2
```
and so on.

Could you please perform the same changes as on your other PR about `Nat`? Eg here this should become
```suggestion
theorem div_le_iff_of_dvd_of_pos {a b c : ℤ} (hb : 0 < b) (hba : b ∣ a) : a / b ≤ c ↔ a ≤ b * c := by
```
but the other lemmas need changing too
Can you also fix the variable implicitness? Thanks!
I followed the same approach as in #23100: the variables that appear in hypothesis are implicit. Those that don't, are explicit after the hypothesis.

```suggestion
    mul_assoc, mul_comm y b, _root_.mul_le_mul_left hd ,_root_.mul_le_mul_left hb]
```
You've got a few more below

Your lemmas are iffs, not equalities, so you should make as many variables implicit as possible
```suggestion
theorem div_le_iff_of_dvd_of_pos {a b c : ℤ} (hb : 0 < b) (hba : b ∣ a) :
    a / b ≤ c ↔ a ≤ b * c := by
```

Ok, 
what is the rationale for using different methods in equalities and iffs?

pullRequest.title: feat: add rewriting lemmas for integers
